intro: Leucosyke buderi, commonly known as the African star orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant features a slender, upright stem with a single, showy white or pale yellow flower that resembles a star, hence its common name. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, greenish flowers that bloom in late summer. The botanical characteristics of Leucosyke buderi make it a unique and sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
